dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 345 IH: To make persons who conspire to commit, commit, or benefit from an act of human trafficking ineligible for admission to the United States of America.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Grayson introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To make persons who conspire to commit, commit, or benefit from an act of human trafficking ineligible for admission to the United States of America.

section.text: Section 212(a)(2)(H)(i) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1182(a)(2)(H)(i)) is amended by striking “who commits or conspires to commit human trafficking offenses” and inserting “who commits or conspires to commit a human trafficking offense”.

section.header: Permanent exclusion of persons who have benefited from illicit activities of traffickers in persons
section.text: Section 212(a)(2)(H)(ii) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1182(a)(2)(H)(ii)) is amended by striking “has, within the previous 5 years, obtained any financial or other benefit from the illicit activity” and inserting “has obtained any financial or other benefit from the illicit activity”.
